column1: REFLECTIONS : WHAT DID YOU LEARN FROM ANALYZING YOUR POWER.  TALK ABOUT SOME POTENTIAL TRADEOFFS.

I determined the “days of use” metric by modeling how long the device spends in each operating mode per day and combining that with the measured and datasheet-based power consumption. By comparing the total daily energy usage with the effective battery capacity, I estimated the overall runtime in days.

Based on the results, a 500mAh LiPo battery is close to optimal for this device. It comfortably supports more than 24 hours of operation while keeping the device compact and low-cost.

To improve user experience, I could reduce WiFi transmission frequency or increase deep sleep time, trading off real-time data updates for longer battery life. Hardware changes like a more efficient regulator or lower-power radio could further improve performance, but would increase cost and design complexity.
